TextRankQuestions.question: What is the main idea of this passage?
choices: According to the 2016 data compiled by the OECD, South Korea’s current working hours are longer than any other developed country: the average person works 2069 hours per year.
Japan has the problem of “excessive fatigue and death,” not only statistical data, but also Japanese people have a word for this term: overwork.
Only 4% of countries adhere to the ILO's recommendations and set international labor standards to a maximum of 48 hours or less in the work week.
Reduce wages, job insecurity and cultural issues.
